name: Quell 4D
description: A high-octane FPS made specifically for VR. Inspired by mid 90's retro shooters, Quell 4D combines free movement, an arsenal of unique weapons and a lineup of varied enemies and bosses to bring you hours upon hours of fun gunplay.
minimum_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 7 or Higher Processor: Intel Core i5 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 7 GB available space Sound Card: Integrated Sound Card
recommended_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 7 or Higher Processor: Intel Core i7 Memory: 12 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 7 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Highly enjoyable. Initially, I had buyer's remorse (I usually always get this...) but was very pleased when it went away after about 5 minutes. I think the controls are fantastic. Really awesome to finally play a Vive game that is virtually a finished product. Probably needs a bit of fine-tuning, but this one is definitely going to hold my interest for a while. You WILL feel like a bad ♥♥♥ when strafing with a shotgun blowing enemies in half.

This game brings back nostalgia from when I played Wolfenstien 3D on my 386 back in the early 90's, only now I'm in VR and there's elephants with machine guns chasing me!  In all seriousness, this game is a total blast! Each enemy type is unique and requires a different skill to defeat. In the last update, Ducking/dodging In real life now translates in-game, which made it that much more fun to play. I'm currently stuck on the final level of the first layer (grass/trees with flying bugs) - this Boss Battle is Intense!  I can see where the devs could take this 'interface' for a 3d shooter and translate it to a bunch of older 386/486 FPSes (doom 2, hexen, etc), which would breath new life into older games... Here's Hoping!
the graphics are misleading, theres actually ALLOT more content in this game then i expected. Definitely one of those under rated hard to find gems in the ocean of VR titles.
A lot of fun, I really like it. After playing it for awhile I get a little fuzzy in my tummy. I keep coming back though!
the only way to describe this is doom/wolfenstein in vr

No dice: VR sim sickness from the artificial movement. I thought being able to control the speed of Mucus (your slime mount & mechanism for artificial movement) would make it bearable but after only a few minutes I done. I can't recommend this game if you're susceptible to VR sim sickness from artificial movement. There are no blink-teleports nor alternate movement options.  On the plus side: The graphics are crisp and bright. The shooting (of the starter pistol) seemed fine -- no reload mechanic just like the old DOS FPS game days. I really appreciate pre-made levels and not 'randomly, procedureally generated every time' that's so in-vogue these days. (Sometimes we like to re-play the same levels and get to learn & then master them.) Overall it felt & looked like homage to Wolfenstein 3-D, and that drew me into buying it.
